revision.text:
{{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST |small= |class=Start |B1=Y |B2=N |B3=Y |B4=Y |B5=Y |Japanese=Y |Southeast-Asian=Y |US=Y |WWII=Y}} {{WikiProject Philippines|class=C|importance=mid}} {{Template:WP Philippine History|class=start|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Japan|class=start|importance=mid|milhist=y}} {{WikiProject East Asia|class=start|importance=mid}} }} {{todo|collapsed=yes|inner=*Expand Occupation period section to include information about currency, government organization, how the Imperial Japanese Forces impacted society day to day life etc}} ==Movie production== It's noteworthy that a movie ''Liwayway ng kalayaan'' (1944) was made during the Japanese occupation. Armored vehicle buffs would find this movie interesting because it gives viewers a rare glimpse of captured American [[M3 Stuart|M3 light tanks]] and captured [[Universal Carrier|Universal Carriers]]. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/202.57.89.34|202.57.89.34]] ([[User talk:202.57.89.34|talk]]) 12:38, 20 March 2010 (UTC) == "Recognized guerrillas" == This article, and quite a number of others, use the term '''recognized''' guerrilla.
What is the exact meaning? "Recognized", as opposed as to bandit groups?
[[User:Varlaam|Varlaam]] ([[User talk:Varlaam|talk]]) 08:21, 10 December 2010 (UTC) :Good question. In the context of this article and other related ones, it probably means "guerrilla forces duly recognized by the Army of the United States", which is wording that I lifted from [http://www.chanrobles.com/republicacts/republicactno897.html Republic Act No. 897]. Also see [http://www.gov.ph/1944/10/28/executive-order-no-21-2/ Executive Order No. 21] (October 28, 1944), which says, in part, "A recognized military force, as used herein, is defined as a force under a commander who has been appointed, designated or recognized by the Commander-in-Chief Southwest Pacific Area." I don't know where a list of such recognized forces might be found, but also see [http://books.google.com.ph/books?id=1K-T3ELJZ50C&pg=PA168&dq=%22recognized+guerrilla%22&hl=en&ei=QPACTYLRBcLJrAeEqImRDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=%22recognized%20guerrilla%22&f=false this]. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 03:36, 11 December 2010 (UTC) == "Contributions of the Philippine resistance forces" == Please '''do not''' revert my latest edit.Because it is very essential and important to give them credit for their efforts in the Allied campaign in the liberation of the Philippines.And as I go researching about Philippines during World War II,the resistance forces efforts are mostly overlooked. Thank you.Mabuhay Philippines!!!! —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/110.55.93.68|110.55.93.68]] ([[User talk:110.55.93.68|talk]]) 14:19, 6 May 2011 (UTC) :Unfortunately, your addition lacks specific references to a, or multiple, [[WP:RS|reliable source(s)]]. May I suggest that you look for references to support your addition, and rather than adding it here, where the End of the occupation is for the large part a [[WP:SUMMARY|summary]] of the main article listed, that you find specific references to specific contributions to the sub-articles whose contributions were made. :One such book I found useful was the following: :*{{cite book |title=World War 2 Pacific island guide |last=Rottman |first=Gordon L. |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2002 |publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group |location=Westport, Connecticut |isbn=9780313313950 |page= |pages=477 |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=ChyilRml0hcC&dq |accessdate=7 May 2011}} :If you do a search in that book for the term "guerrilla", you will find multiple references to Filipino and American Guerrilla contributions during that part of the war. I am sure that other books are out there, and wish you the best of luck in improving articles in the future. --[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 15:08, 7 May 2011 (UTC) == New Content 9AUG11 == An IP editor has [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Japanese_occupation_of_the_Philippines&action=historysubmit&diff=444001172&oldid=443154802 recently added] content that was supported by references that were not verifiable online. Although it is not required to have a source be available online, it is necessary for a [[WP:CITE|source]] to be verifiable, in order to [[WP:VER|verify]] content in question. I have [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Japanese_occupation_of_the_Philippines&action=historysubmit&diff=444111135&oldid=444001172 removed content] that appears to be [[WP:OR]], and tagged the remaining questionable reference source, and tagged the section. I propose removing the content all together if the content cannot be independently verified by a third party registered user. --[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 18:41, 10 August 2011 (UTC) Per [[WP:CANVASS#appropriate notification]] I have notified [[WP:PINOY]] & [[WP:MILHIST]] of this discussion. --[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 18:48, 10 August 2011 (UTC) :If the added material is confirmed to be verifiable, it still seems questionable on [[WP:DUE|due weight]] grounds. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 21:45, 10 August 2011 (UTC) ::If found to be verifiable, perhaps it can be summarized into sometype of evenly weighted content? ::Otherwise, it should be deleted. No?--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 09:30, 11 August 2011 (UTC) :::To clarify, I don't question the addition of this material with an assertion on my part that it that it lacks evenness. As I understand [[WP:DUE]] thar would not be a valid ground upon which to seek to suppress material. The significance of the material, even if verifiable, in relation to the topic of the article seems questionable to me. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 21:07, 11 August 2011 (UTC) ::::As stated above the content is questionable, and the weight of the content is questionable. Unless additional sources of verification can be found that can be verified by a second party (as in one not the adding editor) the content and source will be removed by myself no sooner than 25AUG11. --[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 17:33, 18 August 2011 (UTC) == Removing '''Disputed-section''' tag added in August 2011 == I've removed a {{tl|disputed-section}} template added in [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Japanese_occupation_of_the_Philippines&diff=prev&oldid=444110476 this] August 2011 edit. Per the template docs, there should be a talk page section here explaining what is disputed. The edit which placed the template removed content from the article, so I presume that the article no longer contains the content which was disputed. See the links in the foregoing for more info. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 08:45, 8 January 2013 (UTC) :The disputed content, which remains is as follows: {{quote|Among the signal units of Col Peralta were the 61 Signal Company manned by 2Lt [[Ludovico Arroyo Bañas]], which was attached to forces of the 6th Military Division, stationed in Passi, Iloilo, under the command of Capt. Eliseo Espia; and the 64th Signal Company of the same Military Division, under the Command of Lt. Col. Cesar Hechanova, to which 2Lt. Bañas was given the responsibility sometime later.}} :It is referenced to an affidavit that allegedly exists in Quezon City. As [[WP:RS|reliable source]] states that a source need not be online for it to be used, and as I live in California, I am seeking that someone who can see if this document actually exist.--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 01:55, 9 January 2013 (UTC) ::I've placed a {{tl|disputed-inline}} tag after the disputed text and the {{tl|verify credibility}} tag which followed the ref of its supporting source. I've removed that tag inside the ref since it concerns the source cited and not the ref. I've preserved the August 2011 date from the {{tl|disputed-section}} tag which I had removed, and I've specified this talk page section for discussion about the dispute. This dispute has been active for nearly a year and a half now; some action ught to be taken to resolve it. Please discuss further here. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 07:18, 9 January 2013 (UTC) ::{{od}}I've added a {{tl|undue-inline}} tag for the disputed content, specifying this talk page section for discussion. [[User:Wtmitchell|Wtmitchell]] [[User talk:Wtmitchell|(talk)]] (earlier ''Boracay Bill'') 07:29, 9 January 2013 (UTC) :::Thanks.--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 18:33, 9 January 2013 (UTC) ::::It's been more than a year, and there has not been any editors who are defending this content; therefore, I will [[WP:BOLD|boldly]] remove it. The actions of this unit is more relevant in the article [[Philippine resistance against Japan]], which could be argued to be a [[WP:SUBARTICLE|sub-article]] of this article.--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 02:28, 6 September 2014 (UTC) == Guerilla currency during the occupation == The financial situation of anti-Japanese guerilla fighters. http://books.google.com/books?id=Ed16AQAAQBAJ&pg=PA914&dq=1936+1941+Lanao&hl=en&sa=X&ei=PsJCU7TZDsKU0AHI_4CABQ&ved=0CGUQ6AEwCQ#v=onepage&q=1936%201941%20Lanao&f=false [[User:Rajmaan|Rajmaan]] ([[User talk:Rajmaan|talk]]) 02:56, 8 April 2014 (UTC) == Moro resistance on Mindanao and Borneo == [[Akira Makino]] http://books.google.com/books?id=xMkRAQAAMAAJ&q=The+juram+en+tado+'+s+act+was+occasionally+performed+against+the+Japanese+during+World+War+II%C2%97+and+the+Japanese+were+clearly+defined+as+enemies.+The+juramentado+never+went+after+Chinese+residents+in+spite+of+the+fact+that+the+Chinese+were+non-Muslims&dq=The+juram+en+tado+'+s+act+was+occasionally+performed+against+the+Japanese+during+World+War+II%C2%97+and+the+Japanese+were+clearly+defined+as+enemies.+The+juramentado+never+went+after+Chinese+residents+in+spite+of+the+fact+that+the+Chinese+were+non-Muslims&hl=en&sa=X&ei=udInUuDgCdip4APRuIDQAg&ved=0CDEQ6AEwAA http://books.google.com/books?id=-H25AAAAIAAJ&q=In+spite+of+the+individual+nature+of+many+juramentados,+the+fact+remains+that+it+was+never+done+against+members+of+ethnic+groups+who+were+not+considered+military+and+religious+enemies+of+the+Tausug.+Chinese,+for+example,+in+spite+of+their+status+as+non-+Moslems,+were+seldom+molested.+As+one+man+put+it,+%22There+is+no+sense+killing+the+Chinese&dq=In+spite+of+the+individual+nature+of+many+juramentados,+the+fact+remains+that+it+was+never+done+against+members+of+ethnic+groups+who+were+not+considered+military+and+religious+enemies+of+the+Tausug.+Chinese,+for+example,+in+spite+of+their+status+as+non-+Moslems,+were+seldom+molested.+As+one+man+put+it,+%22There+is+no+sense+killing+the+Chinese&hl=en&sa=X&ei=AE1DU5SiA-elsQSk74HoDA&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA http://books.google.com/books?id=-H25AAAAIAAJ&q=Nor+was+it+exclusively+anti-Christian,+for+it+was+occasionally+performed+against+the+Japanese+during+World+War+II,+although+more+often+merely+against+the+Filipino+soldiers+who+remained+in+the+constabulary+under+the+Japanese.+The+number+of+genuine+juramentados+seems+to+have+been+rather+small,+however,+as+a+result+of+the+Draconian+Japanese+policy+of+taking+vengeance+against+the+entire+community+from+which+the+juramentado+came.&dq=Nor+was+it+exclusively+anti-Christian,+for+it+was+occasionally+performed+against+the+Japanese+during+World+War+II,+although+more+often+merely+against+the+Filipino+soldiers+who+remained+in+the+constabulary+under+the+Japanese.+The+number+of+genuine+juramentados+seems+to+have+been+rather+small,+however,+as+a+result+of+the+Draconian+Japanese+policy+of+taking+vengeance+against+the+entire+community+from+which+the+juramentado+came.&hl=en&sa=X&ei=mU1DU_OlDMPnsAT8yYJ4&ved=0CCkQ6AEwAA Page 111 http://books.google.com/books?id=LpJuAAAAMAAJ&q=In+spite+of+the+individual+nature+of+many+juramentados,+the+fact+remains+that+it+was+never+done+against+members+of+ethnic+groups+who+were+not+considered+military+and+religious+enemies+of+the+Tausug.+Chinese,+for+example,+in+spite+of+their+status+as+non-+Moslems,+were+seldom+molested.+As+one+man+put+it,+%22There+is+no+sense+killing+the+Chinese&dq=In+spite+of+the+individual+nature+of+many+juramentados,+the+fact+remains+that+it+was+never+done+against+members+of+ethnic+groups+who+were+not+considered+military+and+religious+enemies+of+the+Tausug.+Chinese,+for+example,+in+spite+of+their+status+as+non-+Moslems,+were+seldom+molested.+As+one+man+put+it,+%22There+is+no+sense+killing+the+Chinese&hl=en&sa=X&ei=AE1DU5SiA-elsQSk74HoDA&ved=0CDEQ6AEwAQ Borneo]] Chinese and Suluk Tausug launched joint uprising in 10/10/1943 against the Japanese on Borneo. The Japanese then nearly exterminated the Suluks, massacring nearly all their men, and women and children at a mosque. http://books.google.com/books?id=7PuvyKPz5f4C&pg=RA1-PA469#v=onepage&q&f=false http://books.google.com/books?id=E1D5wKKZDHoC&pg=PA123&dq=Jesselton+189+suluks&hl=en&sa=X&ei=NoJfUuiHNpL89gSdhoGYCQ&ved=0CCwQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=Jesselton%20189%20suluks&f=false http://books.google.com/books?id=7YOxqMKVm0YC&pg=PT121&dq=Jesselton+japanese+suluks&hl=en&sa=X&ei=_IZfUtL-I5H49gT3yIHoBg&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=Jesselton%20japanese%20suluks&f=false http://books.google.com/books?ei=UItfUoGrGYKe9QTOu4CoDw&id=1lrzAAAAMAAJ&dq=Jesselton+japanese+suluks&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Suluk http://books.google.com/books?ei=NY1fUqiTBomC9gTp24G4Bg&id=KLYhAQAAIAAJ&dq=Jesselton+japanese+suluks&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Suluk http://books.google.com/books?ei=wI1fUqTcL4iE9QSWwIH4Dw&id=Ox_TAAAAMAAJ&dq=Jesselton+japanese+suluks&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Suluk http://books.google.com/books?id=RzVUOidajPAC&pg=PA77&dq=British+Borneo+Japanese+Imperial+Double+Tenth+incident&hl=en&sa=X&ei=0CRDU-WaAqTe2QWG8IGQBg&ved=0CCwQ6wEwAA#v=onepage&q=British%20Borneo%20Japanese%20Imperial%20Double%20Tenth%20incident&f=false Suluks were led by [[Panglima Ali]], Chinese were led by [[Alberk Kwok]] (I. http://www.history.army.mil/books/wwii/70-42/70-424.html == 4th column is needed in infobox for Moros == We need a 4th column for Moro Muslims who fought both Japanese and the Americans. The pro-American Moros can go on the American column, but the unaffiliated Moros who fought both sides need their own column.[[User:Rajmaan|Rajmaan]] ([[User talk:Rajmaan|talk]]) 03:43, 13 May 2014 (UTC) == Duplicated content == The content regarding the Moro's actions during the occupation, as part of the resistance appears to be duplicated in the article [[Philippine resistance against Japan]]. Perhaps it should be summarized here, or removed all together?--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 05:26, 21 August 2014 (UTC) :I will be notifying appropriate WikiProjects of this concern.--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 05:28, 21 August 2014 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Japanese occupation of the Philippines]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=700854418 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20080916174000/http://www.oldgoldandblack.com/o_article/last_of_cavalrymen_a_true_hero/ to http://www.oldgoldandblack.com/o_article/last_of_cavalrymen_a_true_hero/ When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=true}} Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 01:14, 21 January 2016 (UTC)
